reviewText: I grew up with this show, and I love watching it.  I'm not a painter at all, but I love to watch him do it.  A lot of times, I'll just listen to Bob talking in the background while I do something else.  He's just so soothing to listen to.The mountain scenes were always my favorite, so this collection is great for me.  I'd love to get the entire series, but it costs over $1000.  So, ~$30 was well worth some nostalgia for me.The video quality is good.  It's not high-def like blu-ray, but it's still pleasing to watch.  Audio is also good - not great, but good.  The baseline volume fluctuates from episode to episode sometimes, so I find myself turning the volume up and then back down.  That's a minor nit, though.  I run audio through my receiver, and I turn on surround sound processing so that his voice plays through my center channel instead of the front two speakers - that just sounds more natural to me (probably because I grew up with his voice playing through a single speaker on a TV).Some notes:(*) The audio is stereo and not 5.1 as the cover photo states.(*) The cover photo says "Full Screen," but that stands for the "old" full screen ratio of 4:3.  If you have a widescreen TV, your TV and/or disc player can almost surely stretch the image to fill the whole screen if you prefer that, but I like to keep it at 4:3 to show the original aspect.A bit pricey in general, IMO, but still worth it.  Highly recommended, especially if you're already a fan.  You can also check if your local PBS station still shows The Joy of Painting (mine still does from time to time).
summary: So relaxing to watch, and it really brings back memories
Title: N/A

reviewText: I started watching Bob Ross a few years back on PBS and i tell you this: this guy can truly paint, i mean truly paint. watching his show I learned put me at peace. So at present I am hook on his work.  Beautiful colors, beautiful scenes, beautiful landscapes, beautiful water falls etc.Thank you.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I bought this set of 3 DVD's to use them to review how to paint mountains with this style.  A few years ago I tried painting and had done it for awhile and liked it.  But then got busy and haven't painted in quite awhile and hoped to start again.  I also bought the Bob Ross 9 one-hour instructional DVD's.  Both sets are exceptional and show you set by step what to do.  Anyone can do it.
summary: Bob Ross Joy of Painting Series: Mountains

reviewText: What can one say about a man so talented?  I watched him as a young girl every Saturday.  I order this for my Mom's birthday and we both LOVE it.

reviewText: My husband was watching Bob Ross Joy of Painting every evening, until the season changed and it was no longer available (at least at our TV subscription level).  So I purchased this DVD set. He absolutely loves it!  As soon as I can afford to, I plan to add to it.

reviewText: I started painting with Bob Ross on tv.  I had been told in junior high to forget about ever doing art work.  I decided  try again in my twenties with Bob  Ross.  These video clips help me to review what I learned some time ago.  They are excellent for one wanting to start to learn to paint landescapes.
summary: I started painting with Bob Ross

reviewText: Saw this guy when a sky channel lst broadcast his show back in the late/early 1990-2000. I found it amazingly hypnotic watching him turn a blank canvas into a stunning scene in just half an hour. His character was as wierd as his hair but most enjoyable to watch. Sadly no longer with us but his shows reproduced here will live on in his memory
